question: Does presenting temporally congruent visual speech alongside auditory speech enhance cortical entrainment to the speech envelope in humans compared with auditory-only or incongruent audiovisual conditions? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Specifically, we show that the brain's representation of auditory speech is enhanced when the accompanying visual speech signal shares the same timing.
content.source_2: Using MEG during naturalistic conversation, we observed that neural entrainment to the speech envelope was not inhibited by temporally and contextually incongruent audiovisual pairings; theta- and low-gamma tracking were modestly stronger under mismatch than under congruent conditions.
content.source_3: We demonstrate that the cortical representation of the speech envelope is enhanced by the presentation of congruent audiovisual speech in noise-free conditions.
